properties.description: The wine is Aliane Meursault Vielles Vignes. The grapes are chardonnay. The vinyards, in the low hills surrounding Meursault in Burgundy, France, have been in the same family for generations. The grapes are picked by hand from vines older than the farm hands, transported in wicker baskets to the press in which they are crushed and separated from their skins. The juice, in aged barrels, will take two years to ferment and be bottled. Tasting a bottle of wine is taking a trip back in time, as well as space.
properties.title: Chardonnay grapes and bottling

properties.description: A very professional pair. The French barrel-makers’ daughter and the American businesswoman, teamed up to bring innovation to wine-making and purveying. And who wouldn’t be passionate about wine? Especially French wine, especially Burgundy wine, renowned throughout the world. How far does that passion flow in their veins? How forgiving would either be of a glass of red cascading onto the carpet, via the upholstery?
properties.address: Metro Street, San Diego, CA 92110, USA
properties.placename: Metro Street, San Diego, CA 92110, USA
properties.title: Importer

properties.description: They were just a small wine shop but no one else in the area really seemed to have the character and knowledge, that’s why Ethel went there every Friday night after work. Even if she didn’t meet a man, and she invariably failed to, she could have an interesting chat with the staff. A little voice in her head tried to pipe up - “they think you’re a sad old lush!” - but she closed her inner ears. She’d learnt a lot about wine anyway, though in these parts developing a taste for the good stuff led to some seriously disappointing dinner party experiences. When the woman came in she was fairly unremarkable. Ethel was staring at her drink and barely attended to the conversation. If she had, she’d have noticed that the woman was clearly clueless about wine and was making a brave choice spending over $50 on a bottle of blended white.
properties.title: Wine Shop

properties.description: She couldn’t see it, but Sarah knew the bottle was there, just waiting for Valentine’s Day. Mom would be looking after Elvis, Martin would be back on time from work, they’d get the good glasses out and a take-out. Maybe some chocolates afterwards, and a bath. She smiled to herself. Maybe they could skip the bath...
properties.title: Sarah's cupboard

properties.description: What networks flow into and out of your life? A woman sits at her kitchen diner in Chula Vista, San Diego. She looks around, noting the first things upon which her eyes fall. Where did they come from? What stories do they tell? How do they connect her to strangers across the globe? Click on each point and read the story.
properties.title: Flow #5
